tagged_story_for_tts:
<[silence:3600]>

The word "français" finds its roots in the Old Frankish "frankisk"<[silence:250]> meaning "of the Franks"<[silence:1200]>
A Germanic tribe whose name likely stems from the Proto-Germanic "frankô"<[silence:250]> signifying "javelin" or "free man"<[silence:1200]>
It evolved through Latin "Francicus" before settling into modern French as both language and identity<[silence:3600]>

Three related concepts are Gaul<[silence:250]> Latin influence<[silence:250]> and linguistic evolution.
